question: Is this quiz going to be hard?
In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?
answer1: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.
answer2: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.
answer3: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.

question: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, use:
U-turns in residential districts are legal:
answer1: On a one-way street on a green arrow.
answer2: Across two sets of solid double, yellow lines.
answer3: When there are no vehicles approaching nearby.

question: U-turns in residential districts are legal:
answer1: On a one-way street on a green arrow.
answer2: Across two sets of solid double, yellow lines.
answer3: When there are no vehicles approaching nearby.

question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
answer1: Ignore it and keep maintain your speed.
answer2: Slow down because the lane ends ahead.
answer3: Change lanes and maintain your current speed.
answer4: Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead

question: When you enter traffic from a stop (away from the curb), you:
answer1: Need a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic.
answer2: Should drive slower than other traffic for 200 feet.
answer3: Should wait for the first two vehicles to pass, then drive into the lane.
answer4: Wait until there is no traffic to go.

question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
answer1: Any lane (as long as it is safe).
answer2: The lane closest to the left curb.
answer3: The lane in the center of the road.

question: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should:
answer1: Slow down as you pass him/her.
answer2: Stop and let him/her finish crossing the street.
answer3: Make eye contact and then pass him/her.
answer4: Hit them as you have the right of way.

question: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes in your direction, you may turn from:
answer2: Either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.
answer3: Either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.
answer4: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.
